com.spectralogic.ds3client.helpers.strategy.transferstrategy

Class TransferStrategyBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.spectralogic.ds3client.helpers.strategy.transferstrategy.TransferStrategyBuilder

  • public final class TransferStrategyBuilder
extends java.lang.Object
    This class allows for building configurable behavior when putting objects to or getting objects from a Black Pearl. The intent is to provide the ability for transfers to be "streamed" or "random access". Streaming, as used in a transfer strategy, means that channels and blobs are read or written sequentially. You would use a streaming strategy when it is important that the source or destination channel is read or written in a predictable, sequential order while a transfer is in progress. Random access means that channels and blobs are read and written in no particular order. You would use a random access strategy when it is not important that a source or destination channel is read or written in a predictable order while a transfer is in progress. Once a transfer is complete, the destination channel and Black Pearl objects are ordered as was the original archived object. You specify that you want streamed behavior by calling usingStreamedTransferBehavior() and random access behavior by calling usingRandomAccessTransferBehavior(). If you specify neither, the transfer strategy used will behave as this SDK behaved before introducing the ability to specify transfer behavior. The 2 methods to call to get an instance of a TransferStrategy, which is the interface that performs data movement, are makePutTransferStrategy() and makeGetTransferStrategy(). Once you have a TransferStrategy interface instance, calling TransferStrategy.transfer() on the TransferStrategy interface initiates data movement. If using a TransferStrategy directly, as opposed to going through a Ds3ClientHelpers.Job, the minimum needed as configuration items in a put transfer strategy builder are:
    • withDs3Client(Ds3Client)
    • withMasterObjectList(MasterObjectList)
    • withChannelBuilder(Ds3ClientHelpers.ObjectChannelBuilder)
    When doing a get using a transfer strategy directly, you also need to specify:
    • withRangesForBlobs(ImmutableMap)

    • Method Detail

      • withBlobStrategy

        public TransferStrategyBuilder withBlobStrategy(BlobStrategy blobStrategy)
        Use an instance of BlobStrategy you wish to create or retrieve blobs from a Black Pearl. There are 2 primary implementations: PutSequentialBlobStrategy; and GetSequentialBlobStrategy. Blob retrieval order is specified in the GetBulkJobSpectraS3Request.withChunkClientProcessingOrderGuarantee(com.spectralogic.ds3client.models.JobChunkClientProcessingOrderGuarantee) HTTP request.
        Returns:
        The instance of this builder, with the intent that you can string together the behaviors you wish, for example: 
             {@code
     final PutBulkJobSpectraS3Request request = new PutBulkJobSpectraS3Request(BUCKET_NAME, Lists.newArrayList(objectsToWrite));
     final PutBulkJobSpectraS3Response putBulkJobSpectraS3Response = client.putBulkJobSpectraS3(request);

     final MasterObjectList masterObjectList = putBulkJobSpectraS3Response.getResult();

     final EventDispatcher eventDispatcher = new EventDispatcherImpl(new SameThreadEventRunner());

     final AtomicInteger numChunkAllocationAttempts = new AtomicInteger(0);

     final BlobStrategy blobStrategy = new UserSuppliedPutBlobStrategy(client,
                                                                       masterObjectList,
                                                                       eventDispatcher,
                                                                       new MaxChunkAttemptsRetryBehavior(5),
                                                                       new ClientDefinedChunkAttemptRetryDelayBehavior(1, eventDispatcher),
                                                                           new Monitorable() {

      • withChannelStrategy

        public TransferStrategyBuilder withChannelStrategy(ChannelStrategy channelStrategy)
        Use an instance of ChannelStrategy you wish to manage the source or destination of a transfer. The 2 primary channel strategies are RandomAccessChannelStrategy and SequentialChannelStrategy. A channel strategy normally has a Ds3ClientHelpers.ObjectChannelBuilder that allocates the source or destination. Random access behavior creates a channel per blob; streamed access creates a single channel to reference all blobs associated with a DS3 object.
        Returns:
        The instance of this builder, with the intent that you can string together the behaviors you wish.

      • withChannelBuilder

        public TransferStrategyBuilder withChannelBuilder(Ds3ClientHelpers.ObjectChannelBuilder channelBuilder)
        The Ds3ClientHelpers.ObjectChannelBuilder you wish to use to allocate source or destination channels. This is used in a ChannelStrategy to manage streamed or random access behavior. This is the same interface used in Ds3ClientHelpers.Job#transfer(Ds3ClientHelpers.ObjectChannelBuilder). The 2 primary implementations of this interface are FileObjectGetter and FileObjectPutter.
        Returns:
        The instance of this builder, with the intent that you can string together the behaviors you wish.

      • withTransferRetryDecorator

        public TransferStrategyBuilder withTransferRetryDecorator(TransferRetryDecorator transferRetryDecorator)
        The TransferRetryDecorator to use when retrying a failed transfer attempt. If not specified directly, the builder will create a retry decorator based on the value specified in withNumTransferRetries(int). The 2 primary transfer retry decorators are MaxNumObjectTransferAttemptsDecorator and ContinueForeverTransferRetryDecorator
        Returns:
        The instance of this builder, with the intent that you can string together the behaviors you wish.

      • withChecksumFunction

        public TransferStrategyBuilder withChecksumFunction(ChecksumFunction checksumFunction)
        The transfer function to use when putting an object to a Black Pearl when the value in withChecksumType(ChecksumType.Type) is not ChecksumType.None. This builder will make a checksum function of the correct type if you specify a checksum type other than ChecksumType.None but do not specify a checksum function.
        Returns:
        The instance of this builder, with the intent that you can string together the behaviors you wish.

      • withChecksumType

        public TransferStrategyBuilder withChecksumType(ChecksumType.Type checksumType)
        The ChecksumType.None you would like to compute and include in the payload sent to a Black Pearl when putting an object.
        Returns:
        The instance of this builder, with the intent that you can string together the behaviors you wish.

      • withEventDispatcher

        public TransferStrategyBuilder withEventDispatcher(EventDispatcher eventDispatcher)
        The EventDispatcher you would like to use when registering as an event observer and emitting events. The primary event dispatcher, EventDispatcherImpl, uses an EventRunner to deliver events. You specify the event runner behavior you want by calling withEventRunner(EventRunner).
        Returns:
        The instance of this builder, with the intent that you can string together the behaviors you wish.

      • eventDispatcher

        public EventDispatcher eventDispatcher()
        Ds3ClientHelpers.Job uses the event dispatcher configured into this builder to emit events during a transfer.

      • withNumTransferRetries

        public TransferStrategyBuilder withNumTransferRetries(int numRetries)
        When not directly specifying a TransferRetryDecorator, this property is used to make a transfer retry decorator instance. Doing so uses the behavior this SDK used prior to introducing transfer behavior configuration: a value less than 0 causes a failed transfer to be retried indefinitely; a value greater than 0 causes a failed transfer to be retried no more than the value specified before giving up. If you do not specify a value, this builder will use the same value as used in this SDK prior to introducing transfer behavior.
        Parameters:
        numRetries -
        Returns:
        The instance of this builder, with the intent that you can string together the behaviors you wish.

      • withNumConcurrentTransferThreads

        public TransferStrategyBuilder withNumConcurrentTransferThreads(int numConcurrentTransferThreads)
        The number of threads used to transfer blobs. Random access behavior uses the number of threads you specify in this property. Streamed behavior uses a single thread when transferring blobs.
        Returns:
        The instance of this builder, with the intent that you can string together the behaviors you wish.

      • withNumChunkAttemptRetries

        public TransferStrategyBuilder withNumChunkAttemptRetries(int numChunkAttemptRetries)
        When not directly using withChunkAttemptRetryBehavior(ChunkAttemptRetryBehavior), this property is used to make a ChunkAttemptRetryBehavior instance. Doing so uses the behavior this SDK used prior to introducing transfer behavior configuration: a value less than 0 causes a failed chunk operation to be retried indefinitely; a value greater than 0 causes a failed chunk operation to be retried no more than the value specified before giving up. If you do not specify a value, this builder will use the same value as used in this SDK prior to introducing transfer behavior.
        Returns:
        The instance of this builder, with the intent that you can string together the behaviors you wish.

      • withChunkRetryDelayInSeconds

        public TransferStrategyBuilder withChunkRetryDelayInSeconds(int retryDelayInSeconds)
        When not directly using withChunkAttemptRetryDelayBehavior(ChunkAttemptRetryDelayBehavior), this property is used to create a ChunkAttemptRetryDelayBehavior instance. Doing so uses the behavior this SDK used prior to introducing transfer behavior configuration: a value less than 0 causes a failed chunk operation to use the retry delay value a Black Pearl returns as part of the chunk operation failure response; a value greater than 0 causes a failed chunk operation to the value specified in the retryDelayInSeconds parameter. If you do not specify a value, this builder will use the same value as used in this SDK prior to introducing transfer behavior.
        Returns:
        The instance of this builder, with the intent that you can string together the behaviors you wish.

      • withDs3Client

        public TransferStrategyBuilder withDs3Client(Ds3Client ds3Client)
        The Ds3Client instance representing the Black Pearl you want to work with. The primary way to get a client instance is to call Ds3ClientBuilder.fromEnv().
        Returns:
        The instance of this builder, with the intent that you can string together the behaviors you wish.

      • withMasterObjectList

        public TransferStrategyBuilder withMasterObjectList(MasterObjectList masterObjectList)
        The MasterObjectList returned primarily retrieved from a call to Ds3Client.putBulkJobSpectraS3(PutBulkJobSpectraS3Request) or Ds3Client.getBulkJobSpectraS3(GetBulkJobSpectraS3Request). The master object list is used in creating the ability to work with a blob strategy.
        Returns:
        The instance of this builder, with the intent that you can string together the behaviors you wish.

      • masterObjectList

        public MasterObjectList masterObjectList()

      • withRangesForBlobs

        public TransferStrategyBuilder withRangesForBlobs(com.google.common.collect.ImmutableMap<java.lang.String,com.google.common.collect.ImmutableMultimap<BulkObject,Range>> rangesForBlobs)
        When getting portions of objects from a Black Pearl, object ranges are the mechanism used to tell the Black Pearl which portions of obejcts to get.
        Parameters:
        rangesForBlobs - When retrieving whole objects, you supply an empty range, e.g.: 
                               
                       final TransferStrategyBuilder transferStrategyBuilder = new TransferStrategyBuilder()
                           .withDs3Client(client)
                           .withMasterObjectList(masterObjectList)
                           .withChannelBuilder(new FileObjectGetter(tempDirectory))
                           .withRangesForBlobs(PartialObjectHelpers.mapRangesToBlob(masterObjectList.getObjects(),
                               PartialObjectHelpers.getPartialObjectsRanges(objects)));
        When retrieving partial objects, you can build a list by doing something like: 
                               
                       final List<Ds3Object> filesToGet = new ArrayList<>();
                       final int offsetIntoFirstRange = 10;
                       filesToGet.add(new PartialDs3Object(FILE_NAME, Range.byLength(200000, 100000)));
                       filesToGet.add(new PartialDs3Object(FILE_NAME, Range.byLength(100000, 100000)));
                       filesToGet.add(new PartialDs3Object(FILE_NAME, Range.byLength(offsetIntoFirstRange, 100000)));

                       final TransferStrategyBuilder transferStrategyBuilder = new TransferStrategyBuilder()
                           .withDs3Client(client)
                           .withMasterObjectList(masterObjectList)
                           .withChannelBuilder(new FileObjectGetter(tempDirectory))
                           .withRangesForBlobs(PartialObjectHelpers.mapRangesToBlob(masterObjectList.getObjects(),
                               PartialObjectHelpers.getPartialObjectsRanges(filesToGet)));
        Returns:
        The instance of this builder, with the intent that you can string together the behaviors you wish.

      • withMetadataAccess

        public TransferStrategyBuilder withMetadataAccess(MetadataAccess metadataAccess)
        Supply an instance of MetadataAccess to record metadata as part pf a put transfer.
        Returns:
        The instance of this builder, with the intent that you can string together the behaviors you wish.

      • withChunkAttemptRetryBehavior

        public TransferStrategyBuilder withChunkAttemptRetryBehavior(ChunkAttemptRetryBehavior chunkAttemptRetryBehavior)
        Supply an instance of ChunkAttemptRetryBehavior when you need to have specialized control over retrying a failed chunk operation. The 2 primary implementations for this are MaxChunkAttemptsRetryBehavior and ContinueForeverChunkAttemptsRetryBehavior.
        Returns:
        The instance of this builder, with the intent that you can string together the behaviors you wish.

      • withChunkAttemptRetryDelayBehavior

        public TransferStrategyBuilder withChunkAttemptRetryDelayBehavior(ChunkAttemptRetryDelayBehavior chunkAttemptRetryDelayBehavior)
        Supply an instance of ChunkAttemptRetryDelayBehavior when you need to have specialized control over the length of time to delay between retrying a filed chunk operation. The 2 primary implementations are ClientDefinedChunkAttemptRetryDelayBehavior, which will always use the delay interval a client specifies, and BlackPearlChunkAttemptRetryDelayBehavior, which will use the retry delay a Black Pearl returns in its payload when a chunk operation cannot be completed.
        Returns:
        The instance of this builder, with the intent that you can string together the behaviors you wish.

      • withEventRunner

        public TransferStrategyBuilder withEventRunner(EventRunner eventRunner)
        Specify an EventRunner to use when dispatching events. The primary reason for specifying this is to determine which threading model is used to deliver events. If it is important that events are delivered on the same thread, meaning that the deleivery order is deterministic, use SameThreadEventRunner, which is the event runner instance this SDK uses. You may specify the ConcurrentEventRunner if you want events delivered on separate threads.
        Returns:
        The instance of this builder, with the intent that you can string together the behaviors you wish.

      • usingStreamedTransferBehavior

        public TransferStrategyBuilder usingStreamedTransferBehavior()
        Setting this property causes this SDK to read and write channels from beginning to end sequentially and causes blob retrieval to be in order. Transfers happen on a single-threaded executor.
        Returns:
        The instance of this builder, with the intent that you can string together the behaviors you wish.

      • usingRandomAccessTransferBehavior

        public TransferStrategyBuilder usingRandomAccessTransferBehavior()
        Setting this property causes this SDK to read and write channels in no particular order and specifies no order in retrieving blobs. Transfers happen in a multi-threaded executor.
        Returns:
        The instance of this builder, with the intent that you can string together the behaviors you wish.

      • makePutTransferStrategy

        public TransferStrategy makePutTransferStrategy()
        Get an instance of TransferStrategy configured with this builders current settings. Once you have an instance, you initiate a put by calling TransferStrategy.transfer().
        Returns:
        Once you have an instance, you initiate a get by calling TransferStrategy.transfer().

      • makeGetTransferStrategy

        public TransferStrategy makeGetTransferStrategy()
        Get an instance of TransferStrategy configured with this builders current settings.
        Returns:
        Once you have an instance, you initiate a get by calling TransferStrategy.transfer().
